tag.desc: The caller must have `{type}` access to `{T}` for the duration of `{ret_val}`.

tag.desc: Function `{fn}` can be called from any thread.

This function can only be called once.
This function is only called by the specified environment `{env}`.

pointer `{p}` must be dereferencable in the `sizeof({T})*{len}` memory from it

tag.desc: The container `{l}` must be empty.

The flag `{flag}` must already have been set.
the pointer `{p}` and its offset up to `sizeof({T})*{len}` must point to a single allocated object
tag.expr: mem(p, p+ sizeof(T) * len) ∈ single allocated object

tag.desc: The value {val} must be in list `{list}`.

tag.expr: ∀ i ∈ 0..len, mem(p + sizeof(T) * i, p + sizeof(T) * (i+1)) = valid(T)

tag.desc: The type invariants for `*{ptr}` must hold for the pointee of `{ptr}`.
the memory pointed by `{p}` must remain consistent with `{layout}`
tag.expr: ValidNum(rem(p, layout.align), 0) && Allocated(p, u8, layout.size, heap)

tag.desc: The corresponding lock `{lock}` is held for the duration of lifetime '`{a}`.
The value `{v}` may become invalid during later usage.
type `{T}` must have no padding bytes
The pointee of `{ptr}` must not be accessed after this call.
The value `{val}` should not be accessed concurrently by multiple users.
The memory block `{loc}` should not have data races.
The value `{val}` is not dropped when it is used in the context of `{event}`.
An instance of type `{T}` must not exist for value '{val}'.
The value {val} must not be in the list `{list}`.
For the duration of the lifetime '{a}', there must not exist a value '{val}'.
There is no mutable reference to `{val}` created.
When value `{val}` is alive, the memory pointed at by `{ptr}` must not be mutated.
pointer `{p}` must not be null
the memory ranges `[{dst}, {dst} + sizeof({T})*{len})` and `[{src}, {src} + sizeof({T})*{len}]` must not overlap
the pointer `{p}` doesn't hold exclusive ownership of its reference
This value `{val}` must not be used as an argument in any other function.
the memory access of `[{p}, {p} + sizeof({T})*{len}]` must be volatile
The value `{val}` remains non-zero for the duration of the lifetime `{a}`.
The pointer `{p}` must be null.
the file descriptor `{fd}` must be valid and open
The value `{val}` is returned by a call to function `{fn}`.
the pointer `{p}` must hold exclusive ownership of its reference
pointer `{p}` must remain at the same memory address for the duration of lifetime `{l}`
